newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: CRICKET-LLOYD KEEN TO IMPROVE RELATIONS.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-LLOYD KEEN TO IMPROVE RELATIONS.

text.p: West Indies'
manager Clive Lloyd wants to repair strained relations with
Australia
when their five-test series begins in Brisbane on Friday.
The former West Indies captain is determined to avoid the
hostility that has soured past meetings between the two fierce
rivals.
"We've come to play cricket but we still want to be
friends," Lloyd told reporters as the tourists began
preparations for the first test at the Gabba.
"Probably...(friendly relations) has got away a little bit
over the years and we want to repair that.
"They had one or two on-field things that didn't help and
people talk about it over the years so I'm just hoping things
get back on an even keel."
West Indies' coach Malcolm Marshall said he has already
spoken to his Australian counterpart Geoff Marsh in a bid to
promote greater harmony.
Australia will defend the Frank Worrell trophy after winning
2-1 in the Caribbean in May last year, ending West Indies'
unbeaten record in test series dating back 15 years.
